description: Probably from Dutch stippel (“small dot”), originally applied to the dots themselves and later to the technique.

entries.meaning: (painting) The use of small dots that give the appearance of shading; the dots thus used.

verbs.description: stipple (third-person singular simple present stipples, present participle stippling, simple past and past participle stippled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To use small dots to give the appearance of shading to.
examples: Don’t you think, Major Vampyre, that eye-brow stippled very prettily?
